Благодаря упорному труду Иноятхон, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 дойные коровы, 10 овец, а также имеет земельный надел размером 0,80 ГА, на которой выращивает картофель, кукурузу, подсолнух и овощи. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Иноятхон обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков для откорма с последующей реализацией на рынке по высокой цене. Доходы от кредита Иноятхон планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и намерена собрать средства на проведение свадебного торжества для сына.
texts.en: Inoyatkhon is 55 years old.  She is married, and she and her spouse are raising 5 children.  Inoyatkhon has a secondary education. The main source of income for the family is raising livestock.  Inoyatkhon started the business 20 years ago with the purchase of 7000 KGS worth of cattle. Thanks to Inoyatkhon's hard work, today she has: 3 dairy cows, 10 sheep, and has a plot of land measuring 0.80 hectares, where she grows potatoes, corn, sunflowers and vegetables. Her monthly income is 10,000 KGS. In order to further expand her business, Inoyatkhon has asked the Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum and Partners" for a loan in the amount of 50,000 KGS.  She plans to use the loan amount to purchase calves for fattening and then selling on the market at a high price. Inoyatkhon plans to invest the loan income towards further increasing the number of animals she has, and intends to raise money for a wedding celebration for her son.

loans.use: to buy steers for fattening and resale

loans.name: Cindy Karina

texts.es: Cindy de 24 años de edad es madre soltera de una hija de 9 años de edad quien a las fecha se encuentra estudiando. Para Cindy lo más importante es que su pequeña tenga mejores oportunidades a las que ella ha tenido y es por eso que trabaja duramente para darle lo necesario. Ella se dedica a la venta de pupusas (preparación alimenticia a base de masa de maíz, frijoles y queso). Con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado construir su casa lo cual es su principal patrimonio. Su deseo es mejorar el piso de la vivienda ya que en la actualidad es de tierra y no es muy higiénico para su hija. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de cemento, arena y grava ya que no cuenta con el capital disponible para hacer el desembolso. Expresa que con lo que gana con la venta de pupusas logrará pagar las cuotas que el crédito implica.
texts.en:
Cindy is 24 years old. She is a single mother of a 9 year old daughter who currently attends school. The most important thing for Cindy is for her daughter to have better opportunities than she did. That is why she works hard to provide for her needs. 

She sells pupusas (a food item made with corn flour, beans, and cheese). With much effort she has managed to build a house, which is her main asset. She wants to improve the floor of the house because it is currently an earthen floor and it is not very hygienic for her daughter. 

She is requesting this loan from FUSAI to buy cement, sand, and gravel because she does not have funds available to cover the cost. 

She notes that she will be able to make the payments on the loan with her earnings from pupusa sales.

loans.use: To buy cement, sand, and gravel to lay down a cement floor in her home.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.ru: Светлана 42 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 детей. У Светланы - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Светлана занимается животноводством, стартовав 5 лет назад, с покупки скота на 6,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Светланы, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова. Ежемесячный доход составляет 9,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Светлана обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Светлана планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en: Svetlana is 42 years old, married, and raising two children with her husband.  Svetlana has a secondary education. Svetlana's animal husbandry provides the main income for the family.  She started the business 5 years ago with the purchase of 6000 KGS of cattle. Thanks to Svetlana's hard work, today she has one cash cow. She has a income of 9,000 KGS. In order to expand her business, Svetlana asked the Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum and Partners" for a loan in the amount of 30,000 KGS to buy cows for cattle breeding.  Svetlana plans to use the loan income to further expand the number of animals, and plans to save enough money to repair her home.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.ru:
Наталия работает на местном рынке как предприниматель-торговец. Наталия реализует женскую и мужскую обувь. Она работает 6 дней в неделю, имеет большой ассортимент товара. В этом бизнесе занята уже 17 лет. Бизнес стал семейным, торгует с мужем, иногда помогает и внучка.  
Наталия планирует приобрести партию зимней обуви на продажу на сумму в 5 000 гривен. Вместе с мужем-пенсионером хотят усердно работать, чтобы иметь дополнительный доход такой нужный для семи двух пенсионеров, которым не хватает мизерной пенсии.
texts.en: Nataliya works at the local market as an entrepreneur-vendor. Nataliya sells women's and men's shoes. She works 6 days a week, and has a large range of goods. She has been in this business for 17 years. It became a family business, as she sells along with her husband, and is sometimes helped by her granddaughter. Nataliya is planning to order a quantity of winter shoes for sale in the amount of 5,000 hryvnia. She and her ​​husband-retiree want to work hard to have extra income needed for a family of two pensioners for whom the meager pension is not enough.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal footwear for retail sale

loans.name: Willian

texts.es:
El señor Willian es una persona responsable, trabajadora y honesta, vive con sus hijos y esposa  en el  sur de Honduras. Su negocio es una pulpería que tiene desde hace más de 10 años. 
Don Willian el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de  manteca, arroz, frijoles, carnes, refrescos, aguas, galletas, churros,  etc. Con el préstamo espera que las ventas en su negocio aumenten al tener más producto que ofrecer y poder así atender mejor  a sus clientes. 
Don Willian espera cubrir las necesidades  que tiene y mejorar un poco su calidad  de vida y la de su familia. En unos años espera que su negocio siga  creciendo  y se convierta en uno de  los  negocios más grande y reconocido de la zona y  seguir  apoyando que sus padres e hijos.


Choluteca, Honduras  –  Septiembre  del 2013
texts.en:
Don Willian is an honest, hardworking, reliable man who lives with his wife and children in southern Honduras. He has run a grocery store for over 10 years. 

Don Willian is applying for a loan so he can purchase butter, rice, beans, meat, soft drinks, water, cookies, donuts, and other foods. He is hopeful that the loan will result in greater sales at the store as there will be a larger inventory that will allow Don Willian to serve his customers better. 

Don Willian hopes to meet his expenses and provide his family a slightly better quality of life. He hopes that his business will continue to grow over the next few years and become one of the largest and best-known stores in the area. This will allow him to keep providing for his parents and his children. 
 
Choluteca, Honduras  –  September 2013

loans.use: to purchase butter, rice, beans, meat, soft drinks, water, cookies, donuts, and other goods for his business.

loans.name: Henry Samuel

texts.es:
Henry, está acompañado, vive con su compañera de vida, se dedica a siembra de granos básicos, oficio que aprendió de su papá,  su jornada empieza a las 6:00 a.m. y finaliza a las 2:00 p.m., de lunes a sábado.
 Para aprovechar la época de siembra y contar con lo necesario a tiempo; solicita un crédito para la compra de abonos, herbicidas, insecticidas, todo con el propósito de ampliar su negocio, generar ingresos, y pagar el préstamo.
Desea seguir ampliando el área de siembra para mejorar su condición de vida, brindarle a su compañera de vida mejores condiciones en su hogar y ayudar a su madre que vive cerca de su casa.
texts.en: Henry lives with his life partner and works in the cultivation of dry grains, a trade that he learned from his father. His day begins at 6:00 am and ends at 2:00 pm, Monday to Saturday. In order to take advantage of the planting season and make to do everything necessary on time, he is applying for a loan in order to buy fertilizers, herbicide and insecticide, all for the purpose of expanding his business, generating income, with which he will pay the loan. He wants to continue to expand the planting area to improve his living conditions, to give his partner better living conditions and to help his mother who lives near his home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, herbicides and insecticides

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for doctor's consults, medicine and dental services.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.es:
Angelina, se decidió por tomar un crédito nuevo para invertirlo en su negocio de crianza de cerdos y aves de corral, con el préstamo anterior ella tuvo una mejoría en su economía y eso la inspira para seguir trabajando con créditos.
Invertirá en compra de cerdos, aves de corral y comida para alimentarlos, así ella fortalecerá su negocio y tendrá más oportunidad de ventas para incrementar sus ingresos.
Su familia sigue con el mismo número de miembros y están muy saludables.
texts.en: Angelina has decided to take out another loan to invest in her pig and barnyard fowl raising business.  Her previous loan led to improved economy and this inspires her to continue working with loans.  She will invest in the purchase of pigs, barnyard fowl and animal feed.  She will strengthen her business and have more sales opportunities to increase her income.  Her family size is stable and everyone is very healthy.

loans.use: to buy pigs, barnyard fowl and animal feed.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia, ha cambiado de actividad económica y ha optado por la venta de enchiladas, tostadas, hot dog y variedad de bebidas. Su horario es de lunes a sábado de 7:00 a.m. A 1:00p.m., con el tiempo ha ganado mucha experiencia en administrar bien su negocio. Con el préstamo anterior ella tuvo los recursos necesarios para cambiar el negocio por uno que le fuera más rentable.
Comprará aceite, salchichas, pan, plátanos, servilletas, etc., todo lo que ella necesita para su venta. Con esto tendrá un inventario muy surtido que le permitirá tener un negocio competitivo para brindar el mejor servicio.
Su sueño es apoyar en los gastos de su casa, ampliar su negocio, salir de deudas.
texts.en:
Antonia has decided to change her business and is now selling enchiladas, tostadas, hot dogs and a variety of beverages.  She works Monday through Saturday from 7:00 a.m. to 1:00 p.m.  Over time she has acquired much experience in managing her business well.

She will buy oil, sausages, bread, bananas, napkins, etc. and everything she needs to sell.  This will give her enough inventory to be competitive and provide better customer service.

Her dream is to contribute to the household economy, expand her business, pay off her debts and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy oil, sausages, bread, bananas, napkins, etc.

loans.name: Kashozi Abamwe Group

texts.en:
Ferediana, 46, is a married woman who has five children. She lives in Kanyanya, Ndorero Parish – Rukungiri District. 

Ferediana runs business selling and tailoring menswear. She focuses on menswear because it is more marketable and she can charge a relatively high price. The business, which she operates with her husband, provides for their children and allows them to get a good education. Ferediana is applying for a loan of UGX 2,000,000 from UGAFODE Microfinance Limited (MDI). The loan will allow her to purchase inventory for the Christmas sales. She expects to the loan to yield more income.

Ferediana is grateful for the support from her group members, UGAFODE, and Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy materials to sew clothing

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.ru:
Наталья – из Павлограда. Это небольшой городок, где большинство людей зарабатывают торговлей разными товарами. Наталья не исключение. Она торгует на местном рынке женским и мужским спортивным трикотажем. Торговое место у нее свое. Опыт работы составляет уже 17 лет. 
Наталья планирует закупить товар к сезону, а именно спортивные костюмы, куртки и толстовки. Для этого ей необходима сумма в 8 000 гривен. Так как таких дополнительных средств у нее на данный момент на руках нет, ей нужно финансовое содействие КИВА.
texts.en: Nataliya is from Pavlograd. This is a small town where most people make a living by selling different goods. Nataliya is no exception. She sells men's and women's sportswear at the local market. She has her own retail space. She has 17 years of experience. Nataliya plans to purchase merchandise for the season, including tracksuits, jackets and sweatshirts. To do this, she needs 8,000 hryvnia. Because she does not currently possess these additional funds, she needs financial support from Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase sportswear, jackets and hoodies

loans.name: El Milagro 2 Group

texts.en:
Maria is the group coordinator for El Milagro (The Miracle) 2. Maria lives in Hato Mayor, a rural area in the Dominican Republic. Her home is composed of her long-term partner and her two children. She said she enjoys doing business and her most important dream is to build her house, which she started by saving her profits after she started her business almost six years ago with her first Esperanza loan. 

Maria has successfully completed six and a half years of loans with Esperanza and this is her 14th loan. She sells shoes, clothes, and accessories from her home and by walking around her community, etc. She would like to continue expanding her business by increasing her inventory to access more clients and sell more products. She will use this loan to buy many pairs of shoes, sandals, sneakers, and other types of shoes, as well as clothes and women's accessories. She thanks you all for your support!

loans.use: To buy miscellaneous products (cosmetics, shoes,  jewelry, clothes)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, iron bars and gravel to build a retaining wall in order to secure her home and land.

loans.name: Mujeres Adelante Al Progreso 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Simon is the coordinator of his group, Mujeres Adelante Al Progreso (Forward towards progress women) 1, 2 & 3. Simon began working with Esperanza because he was looking for a loan to invest in his business. He says that his most difficult challenges are raising his children in a foreign country and providing for his family. He lives in a Batey (Company town where sugar workers live) with his long term partner and their two children.

Simon is excited to be taking his 10th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid his previous loan and grown his business. He has had his business for over 8 years, starting up with some savings. He plans to use this loan to invest in his business by buying clothes and perfumes for men and women, cosmetics and some shoes. He will use the profits to invest in his business. 

This group is located in San Pedro de Macoris, a city famous for baseball players and sugar cane industry, in one of the rural area surrounded by sugar cane plantation. In his future, he sees himself running a big store. He thanks all of you for your support!!!

loans.use: to invest in his business by buying clothes and perfumes for men and women, cosmetics and some shoes.

loans.name: Cecilia Nohemy

texts.es:
Cecilia, invertirá en la compra de ropa, maíz, harina, chicharrón, gas y  todo lo necesario para poder ofrecer un producto de calidad a sus clientes y seguir ampliando el negocio, ella resalta que ha tenido un efecto muy positivo en su negocio de pupuseria y meriendas, ya que sus clientes están muy satisfechos, sus ventas aumentaron, cumplió con el compromiso de pagar el préstamo.
Con los ingresos extras ha mejorado su vivienda, cambio de piso de tierra a un piso de cemento, brinda mejor alimentación a su familia.
texts.en: Cecilia will invest her loan in buying clothing, corn, flour, pork rinds, gas and all the other things she needs to be able to offer her customers a high quality product and continue expanding her business. She says that her previous loan had a very positive effect on her restaurant business, as her customers were very satisfied, her sales increased and she was able to pay back the money. With the additional income she has made some home improvements, including replacing the earthen floor with a cement floor, and she has also been able to better feed her family.

loans.use: to buy clothing, corn, flour, sausage and & gas

loans.name: Ivoga

texts.en: Ivoga is a 38-year-old woman who is married with three children. She has a small business, a canteen. She has five years of experience with this business. Ivoga needs a loan to buy boxes of cup and bowl noodles, packets of ice-pops, twisties, rice, and chicken. She will use her profits to expand her business. Ivoga joined SPBD in 2008 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy boxes of cup and bowl noodles, packets of ice-pops, twisties, rice, and chicken

loans.name: Faamanatu

texts.en:
Faamanatu is a 53-year-old married woman with five children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, taamu, bananas, and yams to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. Faamanatu has requested a loan to buy chemicals, wheelbarrows, bush knives, rakes, and water gallons.

She has been a member of SPBD since 2009. With her profits, Faamanatu hopes to extend her house.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, wheelbarrows, bush knives, rakes, and water gallons

loans.name: Iuni

texts.en: Iuni is a 48-year-old married woman with six children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, banana, taamu, etc. to earn a living. She has been doing this for five years. Iuni has requested a loan to buy bush-knives, wheelbarrows, chemicals, fertilizer, crowbars and pickaxes. She has been a member of SPBD since 2008. With her profits, Iuni hopes to extend her house.

loans.use: to buy bush-knives, wheelbarrows, chemicals, fertilizer, crowbars and pickaxes

loans.name: Sapani

texts.en:
Sapani, age 38, makes and sells banana chips in her community to earn a living. She has been engaged in this business for four years. She and her husband have seven children.
 
Sapani joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to capital. She has requested a loan to buy bananas, dripping oil, salt, and plastic bags in order to produce and package banana chips to offer for sale. 

With her increased earnings, Sapani will expand her business.

loans.use: to buy bananas, dripping oil, salt, and plastic bags in order to produce and package banana chips to offer for sale

loans.name: Eseta

texts.en:
Eseta is 35 years old and married with five children. She makes and sells elei materials (hand-printed fabrics) to earn a living and has been doing this for two years. 

Eseta has requested a loan to buy brushes, an elei board (for printing fabric),  and paint. She plans to use her profits to expand her business. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy brushes, elei board, and paint

loans.name: Sose

texts.en:
Sose is a 43-year-old married woman with five children. 

She has a small vegetable garden and grows cucumbers, pumpkins, tomatoes, etc., to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. Sose has requested a loan to buy vegetable seeds, fertilizers, weedspray, chemicals, a rake, and a garden hose.

She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. With her profits, Sose hopes to improve and extend her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, fertilizers, weedspray, chemicals, a rake, and a garden hose

loans.name: Jaqueline Iveth

texts.es: Jaqueline de  28 años de edad vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijas de 7 y 13 años de edad. Desde hace dos años logro establecer un pequeño establecimiento en el cual vende papel, cuadernos, lapiceros, borradores, etc.  El negocio lo tiene en la escuela de su localidad lo cual le permite tener un mercado seguro para la venta. Con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado construir una pequeña casa de ladrillo lo cual es su principal patrimonio. Desea continuar mejorando las condiciones para su familia para lo cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la introducción de la energía eléctrica ya que no cuenta con el servicio y  además, desea construir un muro de retención para lo cual comprará ladrillo, cemento y arena. Espera poder contar con dicha ayuda.
texts.en: Jaqueline, who is 28, lives with her husband and two daughters aged 7 and 13.  Two years ago she managed to set up small premises where she sells paper, exercise books, pencils, rubbers, etc.  She runs her business in her local school which guarantees her a ready market for her goods.  Through a great deal of hard work she has managed to build a small brick house which is her main asset.  She wants to continue improving her family's living conditions and so she is applying to FUSAI for this loan to have an electricity supply installed (as she does not have one at present). She will also use it to buy bricks, cement and sand, as she also wants to build a retaining wall.  She very much hopes that this help will be forthcoming.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement and sand to build a retaining wall and have an electricity supply installed.

loans.name: Racheal

texts.en:
Racheal is married and has five children, four of whom attend school. She also takes care of her younger brother and sister. She resides in a home with electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding her family.  

For the past six years, Racheal has run a business selling green bananas. She works at the market and sells on retail basis six days a week. Her major business challenges include thieves and seasonality. 

She is applying for a loan of 1,500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas. She aspires to become a wholesaler and finance her children's education up to a university level.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of green bananas

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente vive en casa  de un familiar con su compañera de vida y su hija, él se dedica a la  venta de frutas y verduras, fresas, plátanos, naranjas, tomates, cebollas, chiles entre otros tiene 2 años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, anda su mercadería en su pick up  que le sirve para trasladarse de colonia en colonia, ya tiene mucha clientela que lo prefieren porque su producto es fresco, a buen precio, de calidad y con un excelente servicio; el cliente siempre está buscando alternativas que le permitan alcanzar el éxito, en las últimas semanas aumento la demanda y quiere aprovechar para realizar una nueva inversión pero no posee de suficiente capital que lo respalde por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar frutas y verduras por mayor. Él tiene buenas referencias de pago, esta agradecido con el apoyo y asegura que podrá saldar la deuda, a la vez confía que le dará a su familia una vida mejor.
texts.en:
This client lives in his family home with his life partner and their daughter. He earns his living selling fruits and vegetables, strawberries, plantains, oranges, tomatoes, onions, chilies, and more. He has been in this business for two years, and this has given him a great deal of sales experience that allows him to make better earnings. He carries his merchandise in his pick-up truck, which he uses to travel from community to community. He now has a lot of customers who prefer him because his products are fresh, affordable, and high-quality and his service is excellent. 

The client is always looking for alternatives that will allow him to achieve success. In recent weeks, demand has increased. He would like to take advantage of that by making a new investment, but he doesn't have enough capital. Thus he is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL to allow him to buy fruits and vegetables at wholesale. He has good credit references and is grateful for the support. He says he will be able to pay back the debt, and he has faith that he will give his family a better life.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables at wholesale.

loans.name: Juan De La Cruz

texts.es:
EL Sr. Juan, casado, padres responsables de cuatro hijos menores, es originario del Sauce, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del país. El se caracteriza por ser trabajador, responsable con ganas de superación personal en sus ratos libres le gusta disfrutar de su familia. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudor cursar una carrera universitaria y se vio obligada a trabajar desde temprana edad. Para ayudar con los gastos del hogar. Por tal motivo lucha día  a día para brindarles un futuro mejor a sus hijos. 
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta de ganado actividad que la desempeña en su casa de habitación y de forma ambulante. Actividad que le dedica unas 8 horas diarias, el objetivo del crédito es invertir en la compra de ganado como vaquillas, terneros, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.  Juan agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Juan is a married father of four minor children.  He’s from Sauce, a place located in the north of the country.  He’s noted for being hardworking, responsible with a strong self-improvement drive.  He likes to enjoy his family in his spare time.  Sadly, due to the lack of economic resources and the need to start working at a young age to help with household expenses, he was unable to attend university.  He strives daily to provide a better future for his children.

Thanks to his effort and wish to get ahead, his economic activity is selling cattle at home and from place to place.  He spends about 8 hours daily in this activity and the loan will be used to buy young cows and young bulls so that in the not too distant future he will be able to earn higher income.

Juan is grateful for the help Kiva lenders provide to people of scarce resources and to poor countries like Nicaragua so they can have ways to earn a living with dignity.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Prudencia Eneyda

texts.es: La señora prudencia Eneyda vende en el sector ropa del mercado desde hace 15 años, es viuda dos hijos que ya no dependen de ella, trabaja por tener el sustento para su casa, y mejorar sus condiciones de vida, la señora solicita financiamiento para surtir su negocio de ropa de niño, ya que esta segura que en el mes de octubre y noviembre se le empiezan a mejorar las ventas porque se aproxima diciembre, la señora trabaja de lunes a domingo desde las ocho de la mañana hasta las cinco de la tarde.
texts.en:
Prudencia Eneyda has been selling clothes in the market for 15 years.  She’s a widow with two children that don’t depend on her any longer.  She works to sustain her home and improve her living conditions.

She’s asking for financing to stock her business with children’s clothes because she’s sure than sales will rise in October and November because December is fast approaching.  She works Monday to Sunday from 8 in the morning to five in the afternoon.

loans.use: to buy clothes for children and adults.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rice, beans, pork, cheese, corn, oil, gas, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Raul Alberto

texts.es: Raul vive  con su esposa y cuatro hijos pequeños en una comunidad donde no llega la energía eléctrica, el estudio hasta primer año de secundaria  en la escuela de la comunidad, dejo sus estudios por que se dedico a trabajar en labores agrícolas para ayudar a sus padres y hermanos.Trabajando en los cortes de café conoció a su esposa actualmente trabaja en una finca  de café cercana al caserío donde vive. El desea un crédito para comprar un pequeño sistema solar para iluminarse y evitar  el uso de candelas y candiles que son peligrosos para su familia.
texts.en: Raúl lives with his wife and four small children in a community that does not have electricity.  He completed first year of secondary school in the community school but dropped out when he started to help his parents and siblings with the agricultural work.  He met his wife working in the coffee plantations and he now works in a coffee plantation near the hamlet he lives in.  He wants the loan to buy a small solar system to light his house and avoid using kerosene lamps and candles that are dangerous for his family.

loans.use: to buy a small solar energy system for his house.

loans.name: Koreti

texts.en: Koreti is 54 years old and married with 5 children. She runs a small business selling popcorn and banana chips in her community and has been doing this for many years. Koreti has requested a loan to buy popcorn, oil, salt, and bananas for chips. She joined SPBD in 2007 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Koreti will extend her house.

loans.use: to buy popcorn, oil, salt, and bananas for chips

loans.name: Elisapeta

texts.en:
Elisapeta, age 53, makes and sells elei (traditional printed fabric) materials to earn a living. She has been engaged in this business for two years. She has been with her life partner for 15 years and they have four children.

Elisapeta joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services. She has requested a loan in order to buy elei carved board, fabric paints, brushes, rollers, and materials. 

She plans to use her profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy elei carved board, fabric paints, brushes, rollers, and materials

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is married and has four children, three of whom attend school. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. Rebecca lives in a house with electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding her family. 

For the past five years, Rebecca has been selling half bricks. She works in a shop and sells on retail basis six days a week. She generates additional income from a beauty salon. 

Rebecca is applying for a loan of 1,000,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy half bricks. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She aspires to own a delivery van to make transport easier and also sees herself owning a fully-stocked hardware shop.

loans.use: to buy more half bricks

loans.name: Tanuvasa

texts.en:
Tauvasa, age 52, makes and sells banana chips in her community to earn a living. She has been engaged in this business for four years. She and her husband have five children.

Tauvasa joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to capital. She has requested a loan in order to buy oil, banana, spicy flavor, salt, and plastic bags. 

With her increased earnings, Tauvasa will expand her business.

loans.use: to buy oil, banana, spicy flavor, salt, and plastic bags in order to make and sell banana chips to offer for sale

loans.name: Taliga

texts.en: Taliga is a 57-year-old married woman with eight children. She makes and sells noodles, cup noodles, ice-pops, sandwiches, coffee, etc. in her community to earn a living. She has one year of experience with this business. Taliga needs a loan to buy boxes of cup and bowl noodles, packets of ice-pops, coffee, eggs, tinfish, mayonaise, bread, butter, glad wrap, and snacks. She plans to use her profits to expand her business. Taliga has been a member of SPBD since 2013.

loans.use: to buy boxes of cup and bowl noodles, packets of ice-pops, coffee, eggs, tinfish, mayonaise, bread, butter, glad wrap, and snacks

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella is a 28-year-old, married woman with three children. She makes and sells pancakes in her community to earn a living. She has one year of experience with this business. Stella needs a loan to buy flour, sugar, baking soda, eggs, dripping oil, and a gas burner. She plans to use her profits to expand her business. Stella has been a member of SPBD since 2013.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, baking soda, eggs, dripping oil, and a gas burner

loans.name: Teofila Marina

texts.es:
Teofila es una mujer muy trabajadora, tiene su pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes, bebidas y verduras, con lo cual saca adelante a su familia con mucho esfuerzo. Teofila le dedica su negocio alrededor de 10 horas al día y ella cree que le va bien porque es muy amable con sus clientes.

Teofila esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias  a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mercadería para su negocio y realizar algunas mejoras en su vivienda, de esta manera seguirá luchando para hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener un minimarket.
texts.en:
Teofila is a very hard-working woman, who provides for her family with her small business selling groceries, drinks and vegetables. She puts a lot of effort into her business, working at it for about ten hours each day. Teofila thinks that she does well because she treats her customers with kindness. 

Teofila is grateful to Kiva lenders for the help that they give her. She will use this loan to buy merchandise for her grocery business and to make some improvements to her home. Teofila says that she will continue striving to make her greatest dream a reality, which is to have her own mini-market.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her grocery business.

loans.name: Sheikha Group

texts.en: This group is called Sheikha, which is made up of five members, who are ladies from Taiz, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 280,000 YER. Nassim is 23 years and is a very active lady. She is the leader of this group. She operates a general store business that sells grocery items at very reasonable rates. This business brings her substantial income, which allows her to provide for her family and meet her own needs. In order to increase her working capital, she has requested a loan of 50,000 YER to buy canned food and soft drinks for the further expansion of her business. The loan funds will allow her to fill her client's orders on time and increase her income. She is confident about her business success

loans.use: to buy canned food and soft drinks for the further expansion of her business.

loans.name: Alejandro Jose

texts.es:
Alejandro, casado, padres de dos niños menores de edad. Es originario de León, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del país. Él se caracteriza por ser responsable, trabajador, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo cursar una carrera y se  vio obligado a trabajar desde temprana edad. Razón que lo motivo para seguir luchando y brindarle estabilidad a su pequeños hijos, para que tenga un porvenir mejor.  Y formarlos como personas de bien.

Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación. Una pulpería es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles.  Esta solicitando este credito para comprar arroz, frijoles, azúcar, pan, huevos, leche, jugos, gaseosas, fósforos, cigarrillos por unidad. El dedica a su negocio unas 12 horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Alejandro agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Alejandro is a married father of two young children.  He is from the city of León, which is located in the northern part of the country.  He is known for being responsible, hardworking, and driven to better himself.  Unfortunately, due to a lack of financial resources, he was not able to pursue a degree and he instead had to work from a young age.  This has motivated him to keep working to offer his young children stability so they will have a better future and become upstanding people.  

Thanks to his hard work and desire to get ahead, he has a "pulpería" business located in his home.  A "pulpería" is a small store that sells food products.  He is requesting this loan to buy  such as rice, beans, sugar, bread, eggs, milk, juices, sodas, matches, and single cigarettes.  He spends 12 hours a day at his business selling his products so that in the near future he will be able to make more profits.  Alejandro is thankful for the help Kiva's lenders provide to people with few resources in poor countries like Nicaragua so they can do respectable work.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock his business buying and selling food products, such as rice, beans, sugar, bread, eggs, milk, juices, sodas, matches, and single cigarettes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase winter clothing stock as well as cremes, jewelry, and perfumes.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Anna is an experienced agronomist from the Lernagog village of the Armavir region. She lives with her husband and her school-aged daughter and son. Anna's husband is a contractual serviceman in the military service. He is the main breadwinner of the family.  To assist her husband in earning a living for the family, Ann is engaged in breeding cattle, piglets, and hens and in the cultivation of alfalfa. She sells the agricultural products in the local market. As  life is getting more expensive day by day, Anna wants to expand her agribusiness a little bit to be able to cover her family's needs more effectively. A loan of 3,000 USD will be a great support to this hard-working woman and her family, enabling her to purchase apricot layers, to pay for the harvesting services, to pay for the workforce, to purchase alfalfa seeds, to buy some fertilizers, and to purchase three steers. The loan will help her sustain her agribusiness. Anna and her family members highly rely on the goodwill of the lenders and will be very thankful to them for their help in collecting the needed loan.

loans.use: to purchase apricot layers, to pay for the harvesting services, to pay for the workforce, to purchase alfalfa seeds, to buy some fertilizers, and to purchase three steers

loans.name: Vita

texts.ru:
Вите 37 лет. Она замужем, воспитывает дочь и сына школьного возраста. Она уже 9 лет занимается теплицами. Очень любит работать на земле. Она выращивает ранние и поздние огурцы. Участок земли, на котором она ведет свой бизнес – 45 соток. 
Вита очень хочет реконструировать теплицы перед началом нового сельскохозяйственного сезона, установив в них систему капельного орошения, а также закупить нужные семена и удобрения. Для этого ей необходима сумма в 25 000 гривен.
texts.en:
Vita is 37 years old.  She is married and has two school-age children (a daughter and a son).  She has been working with greenhouses for nine years already.  Vita really enjoys working on her land, and she grows early and late cucumbers.  The plot of land on which she works has a surface area of 4,500 square meters (1.11 acre).

Vita really wants to rebuild her greenhouses before the beginning of the new farming season.  In particular, she wants to install a drip irrigation system inside her greenhouses and she wants to buy some seeds and fertilizers.  To do so, she needs a sum of 25,000 hryvnia.

loans.use: to rebuild her greenhouses and to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Eva Del Carmen

texts.es: Eva es una señora  humilde, originaria de la ciudad de león y madre soltera de tres hijos. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de tortillas y comida. Esta agradecida con Kiva y MiCredito ya que atravez del préstamo que le otorgaron logro aumentar su inventario y ventas, logrando una mejor calidad de vida para ella y su familia. Solicita este nuevo crédito para comprar: bolsas, verduras, arroz, frijoles y maíz al por mayor con el fin de abastecer a sus clientes. Su meta próxima es mejorar la infraestructura de su casa.
texts.en:
Eva is a humble woman, and the single mother of three children, who is originally from the city of León. She is a merchant by profession, making a living selling tortillas and meals. 

She is thankful to Kiva and MiCredito since, through the loan that they previously granted her, she was able to increase her inventory and sales, achieving a better quality of life for herself and her family.

She is requesting this new loan in order to buy wholesale bags, vegetables, rice, beans and corn, in order to be able to provide them to her customers. Her next goal is to improve her home´s infrastructure.

loans.use: to buy wholesale bags, vegetables, rice, beans and corn

loans.name: Alba Marina

texts.es: Alba es una humilde  señora de 44 años de edad, originaria  de Camoapa, Boaco, casada y madre de 2 hijos. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de comida ( Tortillas hechas con maiz nuevo) y sopa. Inicia este negocio con poco dinero vendiendo de manera ambulante, a medida de esto fue incrementando sus ventas. Hoy en día cuenta con otra fuente de ingresos (venta de leche). Su esposo e hijos la apoyan en este arduo negocio. Su meta próxima es remodelar su negocio y mejorar la atención de sus clientes. Solicita el crédito para comprar productos para la  venta de comida tales como: pollo, verduras, maíz al por mayor entre otros, con el fin de ofrecer mejor calidad en sus comidas. Estima que el financiamiento será de mucha ayuda ya que aumentara sus ventas, así podrá  contratar personal y brindar mejor atención a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Alba is a humble, 44-year-old woman.  She is a native of Camoapa, Boaco and is married with two children.  She is a tradeswoman, and makes a living selling food (mainly corn tortillas) and soup.  She began this business with the little money she made selling door-to-door, which helped to increase her sales.  Today, she also makes an income selling milk.  Her husband and children support her in this difficult business.  Her next goal is to redesign her business and to improve the attention she gives to her customers.  

She is requesting a loan to buy the ingredients she needs in order to sell her food, including: chicken, vegetables, and corn wholesale, among other items.  She hopes to be able to offer higher quality foods with these ingredients.

She believes that this financing would be a great help in increasing her sales; increased sales would allow her to hire staff and to ultimately offer better attention and service to her customers.

loans.use: to buy chicken, vegetables, and corn wholesale, among other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials like zinc sheets (for the roof), perlin beams, doors, and windows.

loans.name: Andrés Iván

texts.es: Andrés Iván habita en Managua y a pesar de ser un joven de 19 años de edad, se ha esforzado y con su propio empeño estudia la carrera de contaduría pública en horarios que su trabajo lo permite. Actualmente desempeña el cargo de cajero bancario, pero por no poseer título el salario devengado es muy bajo, lo que dificulta que Andrés realice el curso de titulación y se pueda acreditar como Licenciado en Administración de Empresa, el sueña con lograr ser un profesional de mucho reconocimiento y poder administrar su propio negocio. Solicita su crédito para el pago de su curso de titulación, el cual dura tres meses.
texts.en:
Andrés Iván lives in Managua and despite being only 19 years old is studying public accounting in whatever time he has available when he isn't working.  He is able to do so through due to his own determination and hard work.  Currently, he works as a bank teller.  Because of his lack of certification, however, his salary is very low.  This makes his goals of becoming certified and earning his degree in Business Administration more difficult.  His dream is to become a well-known professional and run his own business.

He is asking for a loan to pay for a class that will allow him to complete his degree.  It will take him 3 months to complete.

loans.use: pay for a class towards his degree which will take 3 months to complete.

loans.name: Karol

texts.es: Karol tiene  24  años de edad, esta casada y vive con el esposo  actualmente. Ella con el crédito pretende comprar zapatos para su tienda . Ella piensa aumentar su inventario de mercadería y así  poder generar más ganancias para contribuir con su familia, ella no cuenta con el capital necesario para dicha compra, ya que es de bajos recursos y no tiene como adquirir el dinero necesario para esto, por lo que el solicito un crédito, y es el primer  préstamo que ha  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja…
texts.en: Karol is 24 and married. She lives with her husband. With this loan, she wants to buy shoes to sell in her store. She is thinking of increasing her stock in order to make more profits and be able to contribute at home. She is a humble person and does not have the capital she needs for this purchase. This is why she requested a loan, the first one with FUDECOSUR. She had not had any loan with state-owned banks before, but FUDECOSUR granted her a loan more easily and with a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy shoes to sell in her store.

loans.name: Arman

texts.en:
Arman is a young agronomist from the city of Kapan in the Syuqiq region. He lives with his wife, their five-year-old daughter, and their six-month-old infant son. 

Arman works in the private sector as a laboratory director. Besides his main job, Arman is also engaged in beekeeping. He sells his honey in the local market, and this represents an important source of income for the family. 

To continue his beekeeping efforts sustainably, Arman needs to make some investments. He is requesting a loan in the amount of USD 3,000 in order to purchase new beehives. With the help of his loan funds, his expanded agribusiness will function more productively. 

Arman and his family are relying on the goodwill of his lenders, and he is highly appreciate your support of his agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase new beehives

loans.name: Santos Aurora

texts.es:
Santos, sigue ampliando su negocio el crédito que se le dio anteriormente le ayudo a surtir la tienda con nuevos artículos para ofrecer a sus clientes y atraer a otros nuevos, le ha generado ingresos que utilizo para darles mejor vida a sus hijos y cancelar sus deudas.
Con la inversión comprara aceite, arroz, queso, pollo, etc., esto le permitirá mantener su clientela, ir poco a poco mejorando su economía para poder tener un negocio muy rentable.
texts.en:
Santos continues expanding her business. The loan that was given to her before helped her to stock the store with new items to offer to her customers and attract new ones. It has generated income for her that she used to give a better life to her children and pay off her debts. 

With the investment she will buy oil, rice, cheese, chicken, etc. This will allow her to maintain her customer base, and little by little improving her economics in order to be able to have a profitable business.

loans.use: to buy oil, rice, cheese, and chicken.

loans.name: G.s. Los Emprendedores Group

texts.es:
El G.S.  Los Emprendedores, está conformado por tres integrantes dos hombres y una mujer. Padres y madres responsables con  siete hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Son originarios de Leon, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Estas personas se caracterizan por ser trabajadoras, responsables, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudieron estudiar una carrera universitaria para tener  un futuro mejor.

Gracia a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora es  Francis y tiene por actividad una pulpería, es una pequeña tienda de productos comestibles como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, detergente, jabón, jugos, gaseosas. Pan, fosforos, huevos. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 12 horas diarias  ofreciendo sus productos para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos comestibles. El grupo solidario Los Emprendedores agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The group Los Emprendedores ("The entrepreneurs") is formed by three members, two men and a woman. They are responsible parents with seven children total under their responsibility. They are originally from Leon, a place that is located in the western region of the country. These people are characterized as being hard-working, responsible, and with interest in personal growth. Unfortunately due to the lack of economic resources they were not able to study for a university degree to have a better future.

Thanks to her efforts and desire to move forward, the coordinator is Francis. She has a convenience store, which is a small store with food products like rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, detergent, soap, juices, sodas, matches, and eggs. She works in her business for 12 hours a day, offering her products so that in a not-very-far future she can obtain better income. 

The objective of the loan is to invest in working capital and stock her store through the purchase and sale of food products. The group Los Emrendedores is thankful for the help that the Kiva investors provide to people of scarce resources and poor countries like Nicaragua to have a dignified way of work.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock her business through the purchase and sale of food products like rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, detergent, soap, juices, sodas, matches, and eggs.

loans.name: Ararat

texts.en:
Ararat is from a village called Qarakert, in the Armavir region. He lives with his parents. Ararat works in the police force, and his father works in the private sector. Both of them work very hard to be able to earn a living for the family. With the help of his family members, Ararat is also engaged in cattle breeding and the cultivation of alfalfa, peaches and apricots. They sell the agricultural products in the local market, which is an important source of their income. 

To sustain his agribusiness, Ararat needs to make some investments. A loan of USD 3,000 would be a great support to this young hard-working farmer and his family, enabling him to purchase five steers, some forage for cattle and fertilizers for the farm. Ararat and his family rely on the goodwill of the lenders and highly appreciate their support in collecting the needed loan to maintain and develop their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase five steers, some forage for the cattle and fertilizers

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.ru:
Владимир – женат, у него есть 4-летняя дочка. Он с подросткового возраста занимается тепличным хозяйством. Он выращивает ранние и поздние огурцы и помидоры на собственном участке в 45 соток. 
Дополнительные средства в размере 15 000 гривен нужны Владимиру для того, чтобы построить новую дополнительную теплицу, а также купить семена, удобрения и пленку для покрытия теплиц. Владимир планирует продолжать заниматься этим бизнесом и в дальнейшем, по возможности расширяя свое тепличное хозяйство.
texts.en:
Vladimir is married and the father of a 4-year-old daughter.  He has been growing crops in greenhouses since he was a teenager.  He cultivates early and late cucumbers as well as tomatoes on his own plot of land, which has a surface area of 1.11 acre.

Vladimir needs 15,000 additional Hryvnia to build an extra greenhouse and to buy seeds, fertilizers and plastic sheeting to cover his greenhouses.  He plans to continue to work in this business in the future and, if possible, he would like to expand his greenhouse farming business.

loans.use: to build an additional greenhouse and to purchase some necessary supplies.

loans.name: Sergei

texts.ru:
Сергей – из Новой Каховки. Он уже 21 год занимается тепличным хозяйством, выращивает ранние и поздние огурцы и помидоры на собственном участке в 50 соток. 
Сергей планирует использовать средства, полученные от КИВА в размере 15 000 гривен для того, чтобы провести реконструкцию теплиц, а также закупить необходимые материалы для подготовки действующих теплиц к сезону, а именно семена, удобрения и пленку.
texts.en: Sergei lives in Novaya Kahovka.  For more than 21 years he has been doing greenhouse farming, growing early and late cucumbers and tomatoes on his own plot of 0.5 hectares.  Sergei is planning to use the loan of 15,000 hryvnia from Kiva to repair his existing greenhouses and to purchase seed, fertilizer and plastic film.

loans.use: to repair existing greenhouses and to purchase seed, plastic film and fertilizer.

loans.name: Ana Bertha

texts.es:
Ana, de 42 años de edad, originaria de Leon, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Madre soltera  responsable con hijos menores de edad bajo su responsabilidad. Se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, con ganas de superación personal. Ella desde muy joven se dedico a trabajar y no pudo cursar una carrera por falta de recursos económicos. Esta situación de adversidad le ha ayudado para querer brindarles un futuro estable a sus hijos económicos y emocionales.

Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta de cosmético de forma ambulante y por encargo como perfumes, rubor, sombra, lápiz de ojos, cremas, bodis, labiales, delineadores, cremas anti ojeras, anti arrugas. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 8 horas diarias ofreciendo su producto, con un peso de unos 15 kg diariamente para transportar sus productos. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de cosméticos, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Ana agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Ana is 42 years old and originally from Leon, a place that is located in the western region of the country. She is a responsible single mother with children under her responsibility. She is characterized as being hard-working, with a desire for personal growth. Since she has been very young she has worked, and she could not study for a professional career due to lack of economic resources. This situation of adversity has helped her to want to provide a stable future to her children, economically and emotionally. 

Thanks to her efforts and desire to move forward she sells cosmetics by traveling to different neighborhoods and by order, including perfumes, blush, eye shadow, eyeliner, creams, body spray, lipstick, concealer, and anti-wrinkle creams. She works in her business for 8 hours a day offering her product, with a weight of about 15 kilograms daily to transport her products. The objective of the loan is to invest in working capital and to stock her store through the purchase and sale of cosmetics, so that in a not-very-far future she can obtain better income. Ana is thankful to the Kiva investors who provide to people of scarce resources and poor countries like Nicaragua in order to have a dignified way of work.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock her business through the purchase and sale of cosmetics like perfumes, blush, eye shadow, eyeliner, creams, body spray, lipstick, concealer, and anti-wrinkle creams.

loans.name: Zubeida

texts.ru: Зубейда, 54 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. Зубейда в поисках доходов для своей семьи начала небольшой бизнес по пошиву женских платьев 20 лет назад, стартовав с суммы 2,000 сом (KGS). Бизнес очень хороший, а самое главное Зубейда с удовольствием занимается своей работой-шитьем, которое приносит ей ежемесячный доход в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Зубейда обратилась в микрофинансовый Банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом, в сумме 135 000 сом(KGS) на покупку двух новых инновационных швейных машинок, а также материалов для производства. На доходы от кредита Зубейда хочет приобрести мини-цех для бизнеса.
texts.en: Zubeida is 54 years old, married, and together with her husband, is raising three children.  More than 20 years ago, while searching for supplemental income, Zubeida started a small business of sewing dresses, which she began with 2,000 som (KGS).  Her business is doing very well, bringing in a monthly income of 30,000 som (KGS).  More importantly, Zubeida loves her work.  In order to expand her business, Zubeida turned to the microfinance bank of Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 135,000 som (KGS) to purchase two new sewing machines and some fabrics.   She is planning to use the profits for the purchase of a workshop to host her growing business.

loans.use: to buy new sewing machines and some fabrics to expand her sewing business

loans.name: Maria Angela

texts.es: María de 31 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus 4 hijos de 16 años, 14 años, 12 años y 3 años de edad. María se dedica a la venta de pan dulce y pan francés.  Todos los días sale muy temprano para recorrer las diferentes zonas de su localidad para ofrecer variedad de pan dulce y francés. Cuenta con muchos clientes ya que es una mujer amable y responsable. Habita en condiciones muy humildes y junto a su esposo buscan las formas de mejorar sus condiciones habitaciones. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en compra de cemento, arena y grava para encementar el piso de la vivienda ya que como se puede apreciar en la fotografía es de tierra y desea darles a sus hijos condiciones más higiénicas.
texts.en: María, who's 31 years old, lives in her own home together with her husband and their four children, aged 3, 12, 14, and 16. María sells French bread and pan dulce. Every day, she goes out very early to cover the different areas of her community to sell a variety of French bread and pan dulce. She has many customers since she's a friendly and responsible woman. She lives in modest conditions, and her and her husband look for ways to improve their living situation. She is applying for this loan from FUSAI to buy cement, sand, and gravel to make a concrete floor. As one can see in the photograph, it is currently a dirt floor, and she wants to provide her children with more sanitary living conditions.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and gravel to make a concrete floor.

loans.name: Asuncion

texts.es:
El  señor Asunción tiene 65 años de edad es micro Empresario, vive en la ciudad de Trojes en el Oriente de Honduras es una persona muy honesta y responsable.
Don Asunción tiene una pulpería desde hace varios años  y está solicitando el préstamo para comprar arroz, azúcar, manteca, frijoles, agua, pan, sal, etc. para surtir su negocio.
Don Asunción espera que esta inversión le permita obtener los suficientes ingresos para mejorar un poco su calidad de vida y el de su familia, en unos años espera que su negocio sea uno de los más reconocidos de su comunidad.      


Trojes, Honduras - Octubre del 2013.
texts.en:
Asunción is 65 years old. He is a micro-entrepreneur who lives in  the city of Trojes in the East of Honduras. He is an honest and responsible person. 

Asunción has had a small grocery store for several years and is requesting a loan to buy to buy rice, sugar, lard, beans, water, bread, salt, etc to stock his business. Asunción hopes that this investment will allow him to generate sufficient revenue to raise the quality of living for himself and his family a little. In a few years he hopes his business will be the best known in his community.

Trojes Honduras - October 2013

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, lard, beans, water, bread, salt, etc for his business.

loans.name: Francine

texts.en: Francine is 26 years old and married with five children. She makes and sells elei materials (traditional printed fabric), Samoan weaving fans, earrings, etc., to earn a living and has been doing this for one year. Francine has requested a loan to buy materials, fabric color paints, brushes, stencils and elei carved board. She plans to use her profits to expand her business. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy materials, fabric color paints, brushes, stencils and elei carved board (for traditional printed fabric).

loans.name: Toai

texts.en:
Toai is 32 years old and lives with her partner of three years with three children. She runs a small business selling cabbages, coconuts, cocoa, etc., in her community and has been doing this for two years. 

Toai has requested a loan to buy vegetable seeds, a rake, a wheelbarrow, gloves and a garden hose. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Toai will expand her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, a rake, a wheelbarrow, gloves and a garden hose.

loans.name: Lotovale

texts.en: Lotovale is 59 years old and a widow with six children. She runs a small business, selling fish in her community, and has been doing this for four years. Lotovale has requested a loan to buy fishing net, fishing gear, a fishing rod and a cooler. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Lotovale will extend her house.

loans.use: to buy fishing net, fishing gear, a fishing rod and a cooler.

loans.name: Zhanneta

texts.en: Zhanneta is an experienced agronomist from Vosketap village in Ararat region. Her family consists of her husband, daughter and son. Her husband has migrated to Russia as a labor migrant. He works there and sends money to the family to take care of their needs. To be able to earn a living, Zhanneta, with the help of her daughter and son, is engaged in aviculture and in cultivation of tomatoes, alfalfa, peaches, plums, quince and apples. They realize the agricultural products in the local market, which is the most important source of the family's income. To continue running her agribusiness in a sustainable way, Zhanneta needs a loan of USD 3,000 to purchase wheat seeds, to buy some fertilizers, to pay for the workforce and for the water bills, and to buy fuel for the agricultural machinery. Zhanneta and her family rely heavily on the good will of the lenders and will be very thankful to them for their help in collecting the amount of the loan to maintain and develop their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase wheat seeds and fertilizers, to pay for labor and water bills, and to buy fuel for agricultural machinery

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is an experienced farmer from Nor Ughi village in the Ararat region. He lives with his wife. Both of them are extensively engaged in breeding   sheep and hens and in the cultivation of tomatoes, eggplant, alfalfa, grapes, peaches and apricots. They realize the agricultural products in the local market, which is an important source of income for them. In order for their agribusiness to function in a sustainable way, Robert needs to make some investments. He needs a loan of USD 3,000 to purchase fertilizers, to buy fuel for his agricultural machinery, to pay for the harvesting services, and to make prevoius credit repayments. Robert and his wife rely heavily on the good will of the lenders and will greatly appreciate their support in collecting the needed loan to maintain and develop their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and fuel, to pay for  harvesting services, and to make prevous credit repayments

location.town: Nor Ughi village of Ararat region

loans.name: Amaketo

texts.en: Amaketo is 19 years old and single with no children. She runs a small business, selling cabbages, tomatoes, etc., in her community, and has been doing this for two years. Amaketo has requested a loan to buy vegetable seeds, a rake, garden hose, gloves, a wheelbarrow and boots. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Amaketo will help her family with their daily needs.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, a rake, garden hose, gloves, a wheelbarrow and boots.

loans.name: Arevik

texts.en:
Arevik is a farmer from Vedi village of the Ararat region. She lives with her husband, three school-age children (son who is 17 years old and two daughters who are 15 and 8 years old) and her mother-in-law. Arevik's husband renovates TVs and is the only breadwinner of the family. To assist her husband in earning a living, Arevik is engaged in breeding livestock of piglets and hens as well as and in the cultivation of tomato, alfalfa, apple and grapes. She realizes that the agricultural products in the local market is an important source of income for the family. 

To continue running her agribusiness in a sustainable way and to prepare it for the winter, Arevik needs to make some financial investments. She needs a loan of 3,000 USD to purchase fertilizers, pay for harvesting services, prepare the vineyard for winter and buy some fuel (wood). She and her big family highly rely on the goodwill of lenders and will appreciate their support in collecting the needed loan amount for sustaining and developing their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, pay for harvesting services, prepare the vineyard for winter, and to buy some fuel (wood).

loans.name: Rene Dagoberto

texts.es: Rene de 37 años de edad habita en casa de su propiedad junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos de 10 años, 7 años y 2 años de edad. Para Rene lo más importante son sus hijos ya que su deseo es que logren estudiar y tener mejores oportunidades de vida. Rene se dedica a la venta de pan dulce desde hace mucho tiempo y de esta forma logra llevar el sustento a su hogar. Con el fin de  mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada y madera para cambiar el techo a la cocina ya que en la actualidad se encuentra deteriorado. Además, desea levantar las paredes de la cocina ya que esta al aíre libre y no es muy seguro ni higiénico para lo cual comprará cemento, ladrillo y arena.
texts.en: Rene, who's 37 years old, lives in a house of his own together with his life partner and their children, aged 2, 7, and 10. For Rene, his children are what's most important since his dream is for them to succeed in their education and have better opportunities in life. For a long time, Rene has been selling pan dulce, and this allows him to support his home. With the goal of improving his housing conditions, he is applying for this loan from FUSAI to buy galvanized sheet metal and wood to replace the roof of his kitchen since it's currently dilapidated. In addition, he wants to build walls for the kitchen since it's open-air and not very secure nor sanitary. For this reason, he will buy cement, brick, and sand.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheet metal, wood, cement, brick, and sand to build a kitchen.

loans.name: Jempiring Group

texts.en: Having succeeded in the previous period, the Jempiring group proceeded to the next loan. Based on the assessment of MUK, the group received 20 M IDR for group lending and the individual people received 2M IDR. Because most have been able to increase the number of pig populations, the current loan was used to buy feed and fix the cage. Ni Wayan used the loan to buy feed. Having succeeded in the previous period, the Jempiring group is proceeding to the next loan. Based on the assessment of MUK, the group received 20 M IDR for group lending and the individual people received 2M IDR. Because most have been able to increase the number of pig populations, the current loan was used to buy feed and fix the cage. Ni Wayan use the loan to buy feed because her sow gave birth to 10 piglets and to build new cages. She was very pleased with the effort that can be developed. She hopes to become a big pig-seller at her village and use all the profits to improve the welfare of her family and make her dream come true.and to build new cages. She was very pleased with the effort that can be developed. She hopes to become a big pig-seller at her village and use all the profits to improve the welfare of her family and make her dream come true.

loans.use: to purchase feed and fix the cage

loans.name: Varujan

texts.en:
Varujan is an experienced agronomist from Paruyr Sevak village of the Ararat region. He lives with his wife, son, daughter-in-law, six-year-old granddaughter and four-year-old grandson. To take care of his family's needs, Varujan has been extensively engaged in agribusiness for more than ten years. He is involved in cattle breeding, aviculture, breeding livestock of sheep and pigs, and in the cultivation of watermelon, apricot and grapes. His family members help him greatly in his everyday farming activities; his son sells the agricultural products in the local market, which is the main source of the family's income. 

The barn of the livestock is currently in poor condition and needs to be renovated. To sustain his agribusiness and make it more productive, Varujan needs a loan of 2,600 USD to renovate the barn and purchase forage for the livestock. Varujan and his big family highly rely on the goodwill of lenders and will highly appreciate their support in collecting the needed loan to maintain and develop their agribusiness.

loans.use: to renovate the barn and purchase forage for the livestock.

loans.name: Benilda

texts.es:
Benilda, es una persona que desde su infancia ha aprendido a trabajar para salir adelante,  a los 18 años se dedicaba a vender lotería, luego cambio de actividad económica hoy en día vende ropa, calzado, artículos plásticos y productos de temporada, su negocio lo atiende de 7:00 a.m. hasta las 5:00 p.m., también depende como estén sus ventas, debido a su experiencia se organiza muy bien para mantener un inventario que sea del gusto de sus clientes. Es madre soltera y disfruta de sus cuatro hijos de 18, 15, 13 y 8 años, vive junto a ellos pues es el pilar principal de la familia.
Comprará ropa ambos sexos, artículos navideños, diferentes artículos plásticos, con lo que estará  preparada para la temporada navideña, generara ingresos con los que ampliara poco a poco el negocio y pagara sus deudas.
Anhela apoyar incondicionalmente a sus hijos en sus estudios y que sean profesionales con oportunidades de un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Benilda is a person who since she was very young learned to work in order to get ahead. At 18 she started to sell lottery tickets and later changed her commercial activities. Today she sells clothes, shoes, plastic goods and seasonal items. She takes care of her business from 7 am until 5 pm, but also dependent on how her sales are. Because of her experience she knows how to maintain her inventory to satisfy her customers. She is a single mother who enjoys her four children, aged 8, 13, 15 and 8. They live with her, Benilda being the center of the family. 

Benilda will buy clothing for both sexes, Christmas goods and plastic goods. With this she will be ready for the holiday season, generating income which little by little will expand her business and pay her debts. She longs to support her children unconditionally in their studies, that they become professionals with the possibility of a better future.

loans.use: to buy clothing for both sexes, Christmas items and a variety of plastic goods.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.es:
Lilian, solicita otro crédito para surtir el negocio, comprara variedad de zapatos, arroz, frijol, aceite, y otros artículos de la canasta básica, para ella ha sido de mucho benefició los prestamos pues ha tenido mejores ingresos, un negocio más amplio, ha salido de sus deudas responsablemente.
Ha mejorado mucho las condiciones familiares, les da a sus hijos una mejor alimentación, salud, y ellos la apoyan en cada momento para que juntos puedan salir adelante.
texts.en:
Lilian is requesting another loan in order to stock her business. She will buy a variety of shoes, rice, beans, oil, and other basic needs items. For her, the loans have been very beneficial, as she has had better income and a more extensive business. She has paid off her debts responsibly.

Her family’s conditions have improved a lot. She gives her children better food and health, and they support her every moment so that together, they can get ahead.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of shoes, rice, beans, and oil.

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit is an experienced agronomist from Masis village of the Ararat region. She lives with her husband, two sons and her elderly mother-in-law who receives a pension. Anahit works as a teacher in the village's local school. Her younger son is a contractual serviceman in the military. Their salaries, however, are so low that they cannot afford a living based on those salaries. To be able to make ends meet, Anahit is engaged in breeding livestock of pigs, piglets and hens as well as in the cultivation of wheat, apricot, cherry and grapes. Her family members assist her greatly in her everyday activities related to farming. Anahit's husband and elder son sell the agricultural products in the local market, which is an important source of the family's income. 

To continue running her agribusiness in a sustainable way, Anahit needs a loan of 2,000 USD to purchase some forage for the livestock and buy fertilizers. As this is Anahit’s first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who did not previously have access to credit products because they had no credit history. Anahit and her family rely on the goodwill of lenders and will be thankful to them for their support.

loans.use: to purchase some forage for the livestock and buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Pedro Jesus

texts.es:
Pedro es un hombre de 21 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica con su esposa y su pequeño hijo, el es muy trabajador, entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Pedro no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional.
Por iniciativa propia, Pedro trabaja como chofer de mototaxi, brindando servicios de transporte en su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación.
Pedro se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada cubrirá los gastos de mantenimiento y refacción de su vehículo, así pues Pedro tendrá su herramienta de trabajo en mejores condiciones y seguirá trabajando con el deseo de lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Pedro is a 21-year-old man. He lives in the city of Ica with his wife and their young child. He is very hardworking and enthusiastic, and dedicates all his efforts toward getting his family ahead. Unfortunately, due to a lack of economic resources and the need to work, Pedro wasn’t able to study for a professional career. 

Through his own initiative, Pedro works as a mototaxi driver, offering transportation services in his city. He works every day for approximately 10 hours, and he believes that it’s going well for him because of his dedication. 

Pedro is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to the help offered, he will cover the maintenance and repair costs for his vehicle. Therefore, Pedro will have his work equipment in better condition, and he will continue working with the desire to achieve his great dream of having his own house.

loans.use: to perform maintenance on his mototaxi.

loans.name: Ashot

texts.en:
Ashot is an agronomist from Kapan city of the Syunik region. He lives with his wife and two-year-old daughter. To take care of his family’s needs, Ashot works in the private sector. His salary, however, is not enough to fully cover the family’s needs. In addition to his main job, Ashot is also engaged in cattle breeding. He sells the agricultural products in the local market, which is an important source of income for his family. 

As life is getting more expensive day by day, Ashot needs to expand his agribusiness to more effectively meet the family's needs. He needs a loan of 3,000 USD to purchase two cows and a calf. He has already taken a loan from a local financial institution but unfortunately wasn't able to pay it back. However, thanks to his hard work during recent times, Ashot was able to run his agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that he will be able to cover the monthly payments. So, he has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. Ashot and his family will be thankful to all lenders for helping them to sustain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase two cows and a calf.

loans.name: Luis Angel

texts.es:
Luis es un hombre de 21 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Chincha con sus padres y hermanos, el es muy trabajador, entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Luis no ha podido estudiar una carrera profesional.
Por iniciativa propia, Luis trabaja en el área de mantenimiento de una empresa procesadora de su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y buen desempeño.
Luis se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada realizará el mejoramiento de la vivienda de sus padres, ya que desea reforzar las paredes, pintarlas y ponerle piso, así pues el seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Luis is a twenty-one year old single man who lives in the city of Chincha with his parents and siblings. He is very hardworking, enthusiastic, and has a strong desire to improve himself. Unfortunately, due to a lack of financial resources and the need to work, Luis has been unable to study a professional career.

By his own initiative, Luis works in maintenance at a processing company in his city. He works every day for approximately ten hours, and he believes that it's going well because of his dedication and good work performance. 

Luis is very grateful for Kiva lenders. Thanks to their support, he will be able to improve his parents' home since he wants to reinforce the walls, paint them, and install flooring, so he will be able to continue working and striving to achieve his dream of owning his own home.

loans.use: to improve his housing.

loans.name: Jesselyn

texts.en:
Jesselyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 5 years. She also earns more income from motorcycle transport.

She is borrowing 27,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like soap, noodles, eggs, shampoo, etc. for her general store business.
